name: script_structure
description: Overview of the basic structure of an LSL script, comprising global declarations followed by states with event handlers

details.purpose: To define the essential components of an LSL script, ensuring AI generates valid, modular scripts with a clear structure

components.description: Scripts begin with optional global declarations (variables and functions, defined outside states), followed by a mandatory 'default' state and optional additional states. Each state contains only top-level event handlers that respond to triggers
components.recommendation: Create small, single-purpose scripts with one state unless state transitions are needed for distinct behaviors

best_practices: Design scripts to handle a single task for modularity and maintainability

examples.description: Minimal LSL script with a single state and event handler
examples.context: Demonstrates the simplest valid LSL script, with the 'default' state and a 'state_entry' event handler

references.title: LSL Wiki: Getting Started with LSL
LSL Wiki: A Basic LSL Tutorial
